IX.iii.1.A.3.b
.
Time Limits to Submit Amended Income Information
Per
38 CFR 3.160(d)
, a claim is not finally adjudicated until the
expiration of the period in which to file a review option available under
38 CFR 3.2500
, or
disposition on judicial review where no such review option is available.
38 CFR 3.660(b)
provides the time limits for a claimant to submit amended income information after the claim is denied due to excessive income or net worth.  It determines the date from which entitlement can be established when new evidence is submitted.
Important
:
38 CFR 3.160(d)
does not extend the time limits in
38 CFR 3.660(b)
for submitting satisfactory evidence of entitlement because of income.  If income information is not received, along with a claim, within the established time limits, then the earliest possible effective date is the date of receipt of the new claim under
38 CFR 3.400(r)
.
Reference
:  For more information on when a claim is considered finally adjudicated, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 1.A.1.c
.
